movies.title: Green Book
movies.desc: When Tony Lip (Viggo Mortensen), a bouncer from an Italian-American neighborhood in the Bronx, is hired to drive Dr. Don Shirley (Mahershala Ali), a world-class black pianist, on a concert tour from Manhattan to the Deep South, they must rely on The Green Book to guide them to the few establishments that were then safe for African-Americans. Confronted with racism, danger-as well as unexpected humanity and humor-they are forced to set aside differences to survive and thrive on the journey of a lifetime. [Universal Pictures]

metacritic.name: Peter Debruge
metacritic.review: This grounded, frequently brutal and nearly three-hour film noir registers among the best of the genre, even if — or more aptly, because — what makes the film so great is its willingness to dismantle and interrogate the very concept of superheroes

usercritic.name: Panchogul
usercritic.review: The Batman es una espectacularidad y una gloria por dondequiera que se le mire, es intensa, cruda y explosiva, definitivamente Robert Pattinson llegó a cerrarle la boca a sus detractores, no tiene comparación alguna y su interpretación como el vigilante es auténtica y creíble. Un aspecto que me pareció increíble aparte de toda la película fue que sigue un patrón muy similar a los siete pecados capitales quedando impecable, la ambientación de Ciudad Gótica luce menos decadente y fría que en otras adaptaciones y Zoë Kravitz desempeña bien su personaje de Selina Kyle sin necesidad de compararse con versiones previas del personaje. No hay escenas post créditos, así que no necesitan quedarse a ver toda la rola de créditos finales.

usercritic.name: ndiansean21
usercritic.review: Pattinson is the best Batman. So much emotion and turmoil and conflict is conveyed even though he spends the majority of the movie under the cowl. Reeves masterfully creates a living graphic novel as blends together elements of The Godfather, Se7en, Zodiak, French Connection, and Chinatown in a CBM unlike any other. Director and artist driven instead of a formulaic studio rehash. The cast all knock it out of the park. Can’t wait to see it again.

movies.title: The Batman
movies.desc: Batman ventures into Gotham City's underworld when a sadistic killer leaves behind a trail of cryptic clues. As the evidence begins to lead closer to home and the scale of the perpetrator's plans become clear, he must forge new relationships, unmask the culprit and bring justice to the abuse of power and corruption that has long plagued the metropolis.

metacritic.name: Peter Debruge
metacritic.review: This grounded, frequently brutal and nearly three-hour film noir registers among the best of the genre, even if — or more aptly, because — what makes the film so great is its willingness to dismantle and interrogate the very concept of superheroes

metacritic.name: Josh Larsen
metacritic.review: Pattinson and Kravitz bring real heat to their scenes together—there’s a great moment where he holds her against his chest as they’re hiding from a pursuer and their breathing slowly, erotically falls into rhythm. Even at three hours, the movie could use more of her.

movies.title: Transformers: The Last Knight
movies.desc: Humans and Transformers are at war, Optimus Prime is gone. The key to saving our future lies buried in the secrets of the past, in the hidden history of Transformers on Earth. Saving our world falls upon the shoulders of an unlikely alliance: Cade Yeager (Mark Wahlberg); Bumblebee; an English Lord (Sir Anthony Hopkins); and an Oxford Professor (Laura Haddock). There comes a moment in everyone’s life when we are called upon to make a difference. In Transformers: The Last Knight, the hunted will become heroes. Heroes will become villains. Only one world will survive: theirs, or ours.
